Empires & Puzzles Goldie Review: The Goblin Queen of Reflect & Growth

Goldie isn't just a 4-star healer; she's a tactical nuke of utility. With ailment reflection, permanent attack growth, and a cheeky grin, she redefined what an Epic hero could do. But two years later, does this Goblin beauty still hold the crown, or has the power creep tarnished her shine? Let's find out.
Goldie: The 4-Star Goblin Who Thinks She's Legendary
Goldie: The Mirror-Wielding Matriarch of Mayhem

Goldie burst onto the scene in late 2023 as part of the Goblin Village family, and she immediately caused a stir. Why? Because she brought a kit that many 5-star heroes would be jealous of, wrapped in a 4-star package. As a Holy Paladin, she serves as a healer, an offensive buffer, and a defensive reflector all at once. While she is technically an "Epic" hero, her utility has often allowed her to punch well above her weight class, sneaking into 5-star raid teams and war defenses. If you enjoy heroes who turn the enemy's greatest strengths into their downfall while simultaneously making your team hit like a truck, Goldie is your girl.

Goldie's design is delightfully mischievous. She sports the characteristic green skin and pointed ears of her Goblin kin but accessorizes with a level of "bling" that would make a dragon jealous. Holding a hand mirror (presumably the source of her power) and draped in jewelry, she exudes a chaotic, vain, yet undeniably charming energy. The fox stole adds a touch of wilderness to her "high society" goblin look. It is a refreshing departure from the grimdark warriors and ethereal elves we usually see; Goldie looks like she is having the time of her life, probably at your expense.
When Goldie was released, her stats were formidable for a 4-star hero. However, looking at her through the lens of late 2025, the power creep becomes evident.

Even with Limit Breaks, the gap persists. A fully maxed (LB2) Goldie sits around 845 Power, while modern 4-stars push close to 980-1000 Power. Her stats, particularly her health, are now considered "low" by modern standards. She can still survive, but she is much more fragile than the newer generation of Epic heroes, requiring careful emblem paths and potentially defensive troops to keep her alive in high-level content.
Special Skill: Magic Mirror of Power
, is a trifecta of utility that remains mechanically strong despite her aging stats.
A solid, standard heal. It is reliable, though not flashy.
This is the jewel in her crown. Unlike standard attack buffs that last for a few turns and can be dispelled,

modifies the base stats of your heroes for the duration of the battle. This means your team gets permanently stronger every time she fires. It stacks up to a cap, eventually turning your tile damage into a relentless avalanche.

For 3 turns, all allies reflect status ailments to a random enemy. This is incredibly disruptive. In a game dominated by status effects (burns, defense down, mindless attack), turning those effects back on the caster is often more valuable than a cleanse.

Average. She requires 10 tiles to charge (9 with a level 23 mana troop or decent mana bonuses). This is a reasonable speed for the impact she provides, though in today's "Very Fast" meta, it can feel a tad slow without support.
At base stats (LB2 ~1603 HP), a 38% heal restores approximately
. While not huge compared to modern boosted healers doing 800+, it is sufficient for upkeep.

+100 Attack per cast. If she fires 3 times in a match, that is +300 base attack for everyone. On a hero with 1500 attack, that is a 20% increase, but because it is a stat modification, it interacts multiplicatively with percentage buffs (like a banner or another hero's attack buff).
Hard to quantify but theoretically infinite. Reflecting an Alfrike's "Mindless Attack" or a heavy DoT can instantly swing a lost match into a win.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities

The Goblin family bonus is unique in that it usually revolves around the Wither and Growth mechanics. For Goldie, she benefits from the synergy if paired with other Goblins, but she is perfectly functional on her own. The key takeaway is the interaction with
; it is undispellable and permanent, making her a "long game" specialist.
Goldie's passive is a 50% chance on cast to deal 90% damage to all enemies and inflict -25% accuracy.

This is an excellent passive for a support hero. 90% damage is negligible for the kill, but it can pop minions. The real prize is the blind. A 25% miss chance can cause an enemy sniper to whiff entirely, buying you precious time. It adds a layer of survivability to her kit that isn't immediately obvious.

on Limit Break 2 is fantastic for a healer. It ensures that Goldie cannot be silenced, mana-blocked, or defense-broken for the first 6 turns of the battle. This guarantees she can get that first vital heal and reflect off, provided she isn't killed by raw damage first.

Upon release, Goldie was hailed as the "Holy Kitty," a reference to the 5-star hero Kitty from the Mighty Pets family who also reflects ailments. She was considered one of the best 4-stars in the game, essential for Bloody Battle tournaments and a staple in wars against heavy ailment teams.

As noted in the stats section, she has fallen behind numerically. Modern 4-stars like Breca and the new Construct heroes have significantly higher bulk. However, her mechanics—specifically the combination of Growth and Reflect—are timeless. "Reflect" is a mechanic that scales with the enemy; the stronger the enemy's ailments, the stronger Goldie becomes.

, particularly in 4-star tournaments and events. While she may struggle to survive in top 100 alliance wars against 6500+ TP teams due to her lower defense, she is still a queen in the Epic tier and a vital tool for PvE content like Towers, where her attack growth helps clear waves faster. She is no longer an "auto-include" in 5-star raids, but she is a specialized counter-pick who still works wonders.
As of late 2025, Goldie does not have a costume.
This limits her stat growth compared to Classic or older Event heroes who have received multiple costumes to keep them relevant. She relies entirely on her base kit and Limit Breaks to keep up.
Goldie is a Paladin, which grants her a chance to boost her defense when damaged. This class fits her perfectly.
Maximizes her survivability. Since her stats are aging, she needs every point of Defense and HP to survive huge hits from modern snipers. The Paladin talent synergizes with high defense.
Her tile damage will be lower, but her Growth mechanic compensates for this over time.
Increases tile damage and the damage from her passive.
Not recommended. Goldie is a support hero; if she dies, she provides zero value. A dead healer heals no one.
path is the way to go. Prioritize keeping her alive so she can keep casting Reflect.
Turns dangerous enemies like Alfrike, Kullervo, or heavy DoT dealers into liabilities for their own team.
The Attack Growth mechanic makes your team stronger the longer the fight lasts, great for bosses and healers-heavy defenses.
Heals, buffs attack, and provides ailment protection all in one slot.
A coin-flip chance to reduce enemy accuracy is a great bonus layer of mitigation.
Her base Defense and HP are low compared to 2025 standards, making her susceptible to being one-shot by modern snipers.
She isn't fast enough to reliably counter "Very Fast" rush teams without a good board.
ailments. Uncleansable ailments (which are becoming more common) will bypass her reflect.
She is an absolute monster here, especially in Buff Booster (Growth counts as a modification, but the reflect is a buff) and Bloody Battle (Reflect prevents DoT death, passive deals damage).
Her Attack Growth carries over waves (in some modes) or just ramps up during long boss fights, helping you score higher and kill faster.
Specifically against heavy DOT or ailment teams (e.g., teams relying on burn/poison or defense down).
The attack growth helps boost tile damage for high scores.
Goldie shines when she can keep firing. She loves mana boosters and fellow healers.

You have heal over time, burst heal, ailment reflect, ailment cleanse, silence, and mana control. Goldie boosts the attack of everyone, making the tile damage from this support-heavy team actually lethal.
Goldie - Any Mana Controller - Damage Dealer - Damage Dealer - Overhealer
Goldie keeps the team healthy and ramps up attack. By the time you reach the boss wave, your team has +300-400 extra attack, melting the bosses.
Her Reflect is a buff. A fast dispeller (like c.Sabina or any modern equivalent) can wipe her protection before your enemy casts their ailments.
Heroes who inflict uncleansable ailments ignore her reflect entirely.
Goldie mitigates ailments, not direct damage (other than her small passive blind). Heavy AoE hitters can wipe her team out through the reflect.

If you pull Goldie, level her immediately. She is a 5-star hero in disguise for early and mid-game players. Her ability to reflect negative effects will teach you the importance of timing and board management. She will be your best healer for a long time.
You likely have her maxed from 2023. Is she worth the Alpha Aethers for LB2 now?

, but mostly for the Ailment Immunity and the stat boost she desperately needs to survive. If you play competitive 4-star tournaments, she is mandatory. If you are looking for a war depth hero for your 6th flag against a specific ailment-heavy team, she still works, but don't expect her to tank.
The community recognized Goldie's potential instantly.
"Holy version of Kitty... very useful and probably the only one worth trying to pull," noted one player upon her release.

There was confusion initially about whether "Growth" counted as a buff for tournaments (it generally modifies stats rather than acting as a standard buff icon), but players loved the permanent ramp-up.
One user famously said, "She is top priority... I can’t wait to bully those ailment givers like they have been bullying me."
A point of contention was her Reflect description. It reflects
ailments, a nuance hidden in the tooltip that caused some lost wars against heroes like Kullervo (whose ailment is often uncleansable in certain contexts or against certain elements).

Goldie is the definition of "aging gracefully." While her armor might be a bit thinner and her health pool a bit shallower than the new recruits from 2025, her Magic Mirror is just as potent. In a game that increasingly relies on crippling status effects, having a "No U" button is timeless. She remains one of the premier 4-star heroes in Empires & Puzzles.
Still a Golden Girl. Keep her, level her, and let her reflect the hate.
